data.name: Tap into Reivhax's robot
data.description:
# Tap into Reivhax's robot
This priciple behind this kata is quite similar to the [mxyxinjin's serie's by Voile][1] where you try to recover a secret from a login function.

Reivhax made for himself an encryption server that recieves input, concats a secret to it then encrypts it. He accidentally made a mistake though, can you spot it and recover the secret before time runs out.

# Your task
You are given a function that encrypts any text you give it, you are sure that it does not do so securely. Write a function `heimdall` that will recover a secret from the function.

It has to do so fast enough before your code times out. (Recover over 1024 secrets in under `12 seconds`)

# Footnote
Secrets will always be 64 characters long and represented as lowercase hexadecimal strings. (`0-f`)

Read up on aes ecb. 

[1]:https://www.codewars.com/kata/59ae7edbba7b60c17500006e
